Issues.Title: Transition inside transition group is not working
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/5jwxaLd4/](https://jsfiddle.net/5jwxaLd4/)





### Steps to reproduce
Press "Add notification" button several times

### What is expected?
New notification slides down in 0.1s (from v-move) and slides from right to left in 1s (from v-enter-active)

### What is actually happening?
New notification slides down in 0.1s (from v-move)

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Transition inside transition group is not working" (#9063)

Issues.Title: Iframes are reloaded when Vue app is mounted
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/pdufour/pen/yQMLJX](https://codepen.io/pdufour/pen/yQMLJX)





### Steps to reproduce
Insert an iframe somewhere within your div that will be your Vue app
`<iframe width="1" height="1" style="position: absolute; left: -9999em" src="https://placekitten.com/204/204"></iframe>`



### What is expected?
The iframe URL should load once.

### What is actually happening?
It loads once normally and then another time once the Vue app loads. If you filter network requests for `204` you can see this in action.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1239145/48454089-cefc7000-e76a-11e8-8f12-783fa13b9153.png)


---
Images seem to act the expected way, the src of them does not load twice in the example given above.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Iframes are reloaded when Vue app is mounted" (#9064)

Issues.Title: Object values on option elements are stringified when using slots
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/SlyFoxy12/eywraw8t/456496/](https://jsfiddle.net/SlyFoxy12/eywraw8t/456496/)





### Steps to reproduce
Create a component with a slot which has select options passed to it that use objects. The options need objects applied for values, although I believe it will stringify the value no matter what is passed through.

### What is expected?
Making a custom select element using a component with a select and a slot for the options should work with objects instead of providing the string value "[object Object]" on change.

### What is actually happening?
Options passed to the component via a slot appear to get converted to a string when passed through a slot.

---
Example JS Fiddle shows behaviour with a normal select control and a custom select control as described when the options are passed through to the select as a slot.

As you will see the select box behaves fine but the custom component always produces a "[object Object]" value.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Object values on option elements are stringified when using slots" (#9057)

Issues.Title: Component name css selector
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
In single file components, the styles section can possibly **allow selectors with the same name as components used**. Right now, if we need to style the component, it must be assigned to some class that may not be used elsewhere. Along with CSS scoping, I see this as a powerful solution of writing styles for nested components.

### What does the proposed API look like?
This is what I am suggesting,
```html
<template>
  <my-component />
</template>

<style>
  my-component {
    background-color: red;
  }
</style>
```

I am not really sure how the loader would convert this to plain CSS using standard selectors. :thinking: 

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Component name css selector" (#9052)

Issues.Title: Slow template compilation in dev mode - is this normal?
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://gist.github.com/dmitrybelyakov/c3274e8b6e6bf8dcfd97b4664dfed03b](https://gist.github.com/dmitrybelyakov/c3274e8b6e6bf8dcfd97b4664dfed03b)





### Steps to reproduce
In dev mode with webpack, edit the component and let it be recompiled.
Comment out HTML blocks and incrementally un-comment them. Watch compile time for the component grow milliseconds to ~5 seconds.

### What is expected?
Should be fairly quick.

### What is actually happening?
Component takes around 5 seconds to compile.

---
So I have this component that has fairly reasonable amount of HTML in it, yet the compilation time grows quite a bit as more html elements are added. Most of my components are around 200ms to compile but  this one takes 5 seconds on every change which makes it extremely annoying to work with.

Is this behaviour normal and can I take any measures to improve compilation time?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Slow template compilation in dev mode - is this normal?" (#9049)

Issues.Title: Conditional template not rendering when it has the same slot name
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/ad17bgtq](https://jsfiddle.net/ad17bgtq)





### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a component that has a named slot exposing a boolean flag in its scope
2. Consume the component with two templates inside it, each with a v-if using the exposed boolean flag
3. Only the last template written in the order of code is rendered

### What is expected?
All templates using the same slot name should render when their v-if evaluates true.

### What is actually happening?
Only the last template written in the code order is rendered. Any other template with the same slot name will not render even if its v-if permits it.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Conditional template not rendering when it has the same slot name" (#9040)

Issues.Title: 使用history模式，且在路由最后配置了通配页面，在ie9及以下会一闪而过。
Issues.Body:
使用history模式，在路由中配置了通配页面404，即在路由的最后添加
   {
      path:'*',
      name:'404',
      component:noPage
    }
这个时候在ie9下，访问已存在的页面，这个时候就会闪一下这个页面，然后才是匹配上的页面。
根据我的初步观察，因为ie9及以下不支持history模式，所以会自动转换成hash模式，但是这个时候路由已经进行匹配，所以找不到页面，转换完成后又进行了二次匹配所以，这个时候页面显示正常。
这个过程进行的很坑，如果不是我的电脑反应迟钝，还真无法发现这个问题。
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "使用history模式，且在路由最后配置了通配页面，在ie9及以下会一闪而过。" (#2475)

Issues.Title: $router.options.routes are not reactive
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://example.org/](http://example.org/)





### Steps to reproduce
Declare page title inside a route.meta.
```
  {
    path: '/device/:id',
    component: Device,
    meta: {
      title: 'Device',
      sidebar: false,
    }
  },
```

use the page title in template
`{{route.meta.title}}`

update page title in mounted()
`this.$route.meta.title = 'test'`



### What is expected?
that 'test' is rendered

### What is actually happening?
The page title does not change.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "$router.options.routes are not reactive" (#2474)

Issues.Title: Warn only when there is no matching path
Issues.Body:
Otherwise it pollutes console with warnings

<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

Issues.Title: TypeError: this._router.init is not a function
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/w26279rw0l](https://codesandbox.io/s/w26279rw0l)





### Steps to reproduce
Open the code sandbox and inspect the console.

### What is expected?
No errors in the console.

### What is actually happening?
There is an error saying this._router.init is not a function.

---
While the app itself is rendering fine, I am not sure what consequences this might have once the app gets complicated. I just wanted to bring this to your attention.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TypeError: this._router.init is not a function" (#2472)

Issues.Title: Router is linking invalid Components
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/csigmanek/cspage](https://github.com/csigmanek/cspage)





### Steps to reproduce
Build the project.
Go to
http://localhost:8080/demos/prime-chain
Open file src/router.ts
Comment out
    import UsefulLinks from './views/UsefulLinks.vue';
and

     {
       path: '/useful-links',
       name: 'Useful Links',
       component: UsefulLinks,
     },

Reload the page


### What is expected?
A route configuration should not influence other routes.

When i specify component PrimeChain to be loaded at the path /demos/prime-chain, I do not expect component UsefulLinks to be loaded.

### What is actually happening?
A wrong component is loaded by the router.
Also, the parent element of "App" is called "Useful Links" which is odd i guess. Other Routes do not rename the root element in the vue inspector.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Router is linking invalid Components" (#2464)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "something wrong with router.beforeEach when slide back" (#2466)

Issues.Body:

Lack of the way to get a route as string.
This one was fixed in previous version, there was a github issue for that (issue number #409 pull request number #426), there was the stringifyPath method.

### What does the proposed API look like?
It could look the same as it looked before

Issues.Title: Monitor the $routine.back () routing changes
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1





### Steps to reproduce
I use $routine.back () to return to the previous page, but using 'watch' cannot monitor changes to '$route', how can this be resolved?

### What is expected?
Trigger watch event

### What is actually happening?
Use monitoring $route to highlight the current column, but cannot monitor events to $routing.back ()

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Monitor the $routine.back () routing changes" (#2467)

Issues.Title: Inconsistent formatting with URL for named child route with no path and query params
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/u3be49g0/](http://jsfiddle.net/u3be49g0/)





### Steps to reproduce
Open the JSfiddle and click the /user/foo link

### What is expected?
The URL should be /user/foo?test=test_param

### What is actually happening?
The URL is /user/foo/?test=test_param

---
This is a valid URL and the query property of $route still works, but the formatting is inconsistent with how query params are handled with other routes in vue router. This occurs only for named child routes with no path since it will automatically append the trailing slash (see https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1273).

Maybe this is intended, but it would be nice if query params were handled the same for all routes.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Inconsistent formatting with URL for named child route with no path and query params" (#2463)

Issues.Title: The path of the RouteConfig is the same as the alias content, which will cause an infinite loop.
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/chenfeng163/pen/qJzxGW](https://codepen.io/chenfeng163/pen/qJzxGW)





### Steps to reproduce
The path of the RouteConfig is the same as the alias content

### What is expected?
no error

### What is actually happening?
infinite loop

---
The route of alias overrides the route of the path, causing the path and matchAs to be the same. When the url is parsed, an infinite loop occurs.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The path of the RouteConfig is the same as the alias content, which will cause an infinite loop." (#2461)

Issues.Title: next(false) doesn't render component when using browser navigation
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/rjwjwqlzlm](https://codesandbox.io/s/rjwjwqlzlm)





### Steps to reproduce
- Use browser navigation to navigate to a page where the `beforeEnter()` method calls `next(false)`.
- Eg. When viewing [rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/](https://rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/) in a browser, paste [rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/](https://rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/) in the omnibox.

### What is expected?
Like it works when using the router-link navigation, one would expect that changing the URL from `somedomain.com/` to `somedomain.com/admin` (or other "protected" route) would return the user to the previous page.

### What is actually happening?
Instead of working properly, the URL is changed to what it is supposed to be, but no component is rendered at the initial route. 

---
A workaround is using `next(from.fullPath)` instead of using `next(false)`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "next(false) doesn't render component when using browser navigation" (#2458)

Issues.Title: How can I remove the routers were add to VueRouter by addRoutes method
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Recently, I am working on a project developed with vue. I used Vue-Router to manage routers.
When I logout system, I want to clear the routers were add to VueRouter by addRoutes method.
Beacuase the routers are calculated by the logined user ,  all the routers data were sented from api.
So when I logout, I want to clear the Dynamic routers except the public path, like home, 404 page etc.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Sorry, I can't found the proposed API

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How can I remove the routers were add to VueRouter by addRoutes method" (#2460)

Issues.Title: [Docs] Mistake in Router Construction Options types
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://router.vuejs.org/api/#routes](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#routes)





### Steps to reproduce
In API Reference type of RouteConfig.params is "boolean | string | Function". But in docs in section "Passing Props to Route Components", there are three modes for this. Boolean mode, Object mode, Function mode. This mistake was included in all languages

### What is expected?
boolean | Object | Function

### What is actually happening?
boolean | string | Function

---
Link to section "Passing Props to Route Components" https://router.vuejs.org/guide/essentials/passing-props.html

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Docs] Mistake in Router Construction Options types" (#2453)

Issues.Title: [Docs] Mistake in Router Construction Options types
Issues.Body:

3.0.1

### Reproduction links
https://router.vuejs.org/api/#routes, https://router.vuejs.org/guide/essentials/passing-props.html

### Steps to reproduce
In API Reference type of RouteConfig.params is "boolean | string | Function". But in docs in section "Passing Props to Route Components", there are three modes for this. Boolean mode, Object mode, Function mode. This mistake was included in all languages

### What is expected?
boolean | Object | Function

### What is actually happening?
boolean | string | Function
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Docs] Mistake in Router Construction Options types" (#2452)

Issues.Title: Prevent invalidating subscription iterator
Issues.Body: This change shallow copies `_subscribers` before iterating over it, in-case one of the subscription listeners attempts to unsubscribe synchronously and invalidate the iterator.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Prevent invalidating subscription iterator " (#1438)

Issues.Title: Return values from mutation commits.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
One often wants to get the id of a created object back from the data store. Much like in a database, if you add an object to an array in the store, you want to get it's id so that you can reference it again. When looking up how to do this, I found that you cannot, and I also found that someone else had the exact same inquiry on stackoverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42404925/return-value-from-vuex-mutation-id-for-newly-created-object#42406872
The response to the question on stack overflow was to use vuex actions, but I don't think that one should have to use an asynchronous action to achieve a synchronous task.
To carry on with the database example, one might use postgresql's "RETURNING" as an analogy. One can perform an insert statement and then say RETURNING thing_id to get the automatically generated id, or whatever other fields they would like.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```
let myReturn = this.$store.commit('ADD_THING",{"name":"new_thing"});
// 'ADD_THING' adds a thing to an numerically indexed object and then returns the number.
console.log(myReturn); // {"id":42,"datestamp":1541145883085}
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Return values from mutation commits." (#1437)

Issues.Title: Unable to install VueX (dependency issue)
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://it-is-an-installation-issue.com](https://it-is-an-installation-issue.com)





### Steps to reproduce
Just install via Yarn and you'll see that it won't install. Error:
error An unexpected error occurred: "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/sockjs-dashboard/-/sockjs-dashboard-1.1.5.tgz: Request failed \"404 Not Found\"".

### What is expected?
Download and install VueX via Yarn

### What is actually happening?
Dependency not found

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to install VueX (dependency issue)" (#1434)

Issues.Title: Getters stop to work in routes under keep-alive after registerModule call
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Alendorff/vue-vuex-getters-bug](https://github.com/Alendorff/vue-vuex-getters-bug)





### Steps to reproduce
* You have vuex store with static module
* You need to register a new vuex module on vue-router beforeEnter hook
* Your `router-view` is under `keep-alive`
* Your components related to different routes have getters mapped to static module
* Bug: when you enter route which should register new vuex module, getters from static module become broken.
Reactivity doesn't work - components with mapped getters do not receive updates.

### What is expected?
Getters should work

### What is actually happening?
Getters reactivity is broken. Components have stale getters values.

---
```
 "dependencies": {
    "vue": "2.5.17-beta.0",
    "vue-router": "^3.0.1",
    "vuex": "^3.0.1"
  }
```

Windows 10, Chrome Version 69.0.3497.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

P.S. Not really sure if I should put this issue into the vuex repository, so pls tell me if there are better place for it.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Getters stop to work in routes under keep-alive after registerModule call" (#1436)

Issues.Title: It is possible to sync vuex state across devices?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I want to make the same user, authorized on different devices, interact with the site, when the state changes, so that it synchronously changes on all devices.

Back-Ender asks to implement the mechanism via *web sockets*   how-to about **change the state from the server(!)**. 
He says that in *react-redux* he calls action with *type* and some *payload*. 
But vuex has **two entities**: *mutations* and *actions*, which adds complexity! Especially when store is namespaced by modules.


### What does the proposed API look like?
  I would be grateful for any help.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "It is possible to sync vuex state across devices?" (#1424)

Issues.Title: Historical API docs (e.g meaning of `strict: debug`)?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Allow new users of VueX to make sense of an older example from the internet (say a blog post or similar). Ran across an example of `strict: debug` (`strict` is now boolean) and can't seem to find the reference of it in the current documentation. Apologies if I missed an obvious link to older reference material.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Maybe a doc version selector? Or maybe collapsible section in current doc of historical values accepted. I wouldn't expect this for alpha level releases, but presumably the example I brought up was a valid syntax in an older major released version of VueX.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Historical API docs (e.g meaning of `strict: debug`)?" (#1428)

Issues.Title: Support for IndexedDB
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It should (in theory) make dealing with Big Data Web Visualizations easier and more performant.

I'm using echarts to render big data vizualizations at the company I work for. The problem is that when my data gets really big (1m records), It's takes way too long to do anything. The app pretty much becomes unresponsive and so now the only alternative I have is to do all of the aggregation on the backend and then return the response.

### What does the proposed API look like?
I would imagine that the vuex instance would send messages back and forth between the serviceworker and itself. The mutations could then be passed as arguments to the serviceworker. The serviceworker would perform the operation and return the aggregated data. If the user does not have third-party-cookies enabled. It would just fall back to the normal Vuex instance.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support for IndexedDB" (#1416)

Issues.Title: Wrong data for getters at least in actions because getters are mutables
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/fqm3tj5y/3/](https://jsfiddle.net/fqm3tj5y/3/)

### Steps to reproduce
clic on "display values" text

### What is expected?
wrapper: values ===  getter: value

### What is actually happening?
wrapper: values !==  getter: value

---
I change the line 17
from 
       let begin = getters.begin
to 
       let begin = moment(getters.begin;)

And this works. 

Anyway, it seems to me that a getter should'nt change and be a copy in every call. If not this should be good documented with an big warning : " Attention : a getter is mutable, copy it, if you want to play with its ow properties."

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Wrong data for getters at least in actions because getters are mutables" (#1415)
